name: Shakshuka on a Budget
description: Cooking on a budget? Eggs are your secret weapon to getting a healthy meal on the table for just over a buck a serving. They’re affordable, delish, and nutritious. Even better, your handy dandy Sauté Pan is large enough to double up on eggs—crack in up to 8 eggs for hungry bellies!
preparation: Chop garlic, pepper (if using), and onion.
Heat oil in Sauté Pan over medium-high heat. Add chopped garlic and veggies; stir-fry until onions are soft, about 6–8 min.
Stir in tomatoes and sauce; bring to a simmer, about 3 min, stirring often.
Use the back of a spoon to form 4 shallow wells in the sauce mixture. Crack an egg into each well. Reduce heat to medium-low and cover; simmer 7–8 min, or until eggs are just set.
If desired, sprinkle cheese over shakshuka in pan. Cover; let simmer until cheese is melted, about 1 min.
tips: Bulk up your shakshuka by adding canned chickpeas or beans in with the sauce mixture.

products.name: Rosée Sauce Mix (Pack of 3)
summary: Tired of the same old pasta? It’s time to take it to the next level with something a little fancy but oh-so-easy to make: Rosée Sauce. Creamy with a rich tomato flavour, this thick sauce is very family-friendly and easily clings to your favourite noodles. Make it with two simple ingredients, milk and tomato paste, in just five minutes in the microwave!

products.name: Sauté Pan
summary: An all-purpose pan to brown, sauté, and simmer—ideal for one pan meals.
